entry.title: FrankenStat
entry.content:
I’ve had the idea of making my own thermostat for years as most of the commercial ones lacked options wanted or, if they had the options, where terribly expensive. A few month back I stumbled across the Arduino platform and after a bit of playing around with it, this looked to be the platform on which I could make this work. And so FrankenStat came to be.

What I want from my thermostat is:

  • Having a REST API to control the thermostat and get statistics (I love graphs!)
  • Being able to control the thermostat manually with buttons.
  • It should be programmable (have multiple temperature settings per day.)
  • I should be able to adjust the temperature temperarily until the next programmed temperature setting.
  • Be able to place it anywhere in my living room and control the CV wireless.

The FrankenStat code is on GitHub.
